meanings.definition: A familiar or humorous name given to a person instead of their real name.
meanings.sent1: My friend's nickname is 'Sunny' because she always smiles.
meanings.sent2: Everyone calls him by his nickname 'Buddy' at school.
meanings.sent3: His nickname 'Chatterbox' suits him well because he talks a lot.
meanings.sent4: She earned the nickname 'Speedy' for how fast she runs in races.
meanings.sent5: The nickname 'Giggles' stuck with her because she laughs so much.

meanings.sent1: I decided to nickname my cat 'Whiskers' because of her fluffy face.
meanings.sent2: She likes to nickname all her plants with funny names like 'Leafy'.
meanings.sent3: He tried to nickname his car 'Thunder' but it didn't catch on.
meanings.sent4: The kids wanted to nickname their new clubhouse 'Fort Adventure'.
meanings.sent5: We should nickname our group chat 'Chatty Crew' for fun.
